titleStmt.title: The clear sun-shine of the gospel breaking forth upon the Indians in Nevv-England. Or, An historicall narration of Gods wonderfull workings upon sundry of the Indians, both chief governors and common-people, in bringing them to a willing and desired submission to the ordinances of the gospel; and framing their hearts to an earnest inquirie after the knowledge of God the Father, and of Jesus Christ the Saviour of the world. / By Mr. Thomas Shepard minister of the gospel of Jesus Christ at Cambridge in New-England.
titleStmt.author: Shepard, Thomas, 1605-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R. Cotes for John Bellamy at the three golden Lions in Cornhill near the Royall Exchange,
